articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's ruling Communist Party has expelled the former chairman of the state-owned Bank of China from the party, accusing him of illegal activities and taking bribes, the top anti-graft watchdog said on Saturday.
articles.title: China expels former Bank of China chairman from Communist Party

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The perennial issue of transboundary haze has again sparked friction in Southeast Asia, with Malaysia's environment minister writing to the Indonesian government this week calling for a regional response to the toxic smoke drifting across his nation.
articles.title: Explainer: What's causing the chronic haze across Southeast Asia?

articles.author: Adrian Portugal
articles.description: The crew of the Philippine coastguard boat watch anxiously as an imposing Chinese vessel draws near and cuts off its path, coming within a metre of collision in a vast stretch of open water in the South China Sea.
articles.title: Near collision, tense encounter as Beijing flexes muscles in the South China Sea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. Commerce Department on Friday added 42 Chinese companies to a government export control list over their support for Moscow's military and defense industrial base - support that includes the supply of U.S.-origin integrated circuits.
articles.title: US restricts trade with 42 Chinese entities over support for Russia's military

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain on Friday reaffirmed its position that all countries should respect sovereignty and the rule of law, after reports said that India had asked Canada to withdraw 41 diplomats.
articles.title: UK reaffirms position after Canada-India diplomatic spat

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Six men suspected of involvement in the murder in August of Ecuador's anti-corruption presidential candidate Fernando Villavicencio were killed in prison on Friday, the prisons agency said, barely a week before a crucial run-off election.
articles.title: Six suspects in assassination of Ecuador candidate murdered in prison

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkish forces have "neutralised" at least 14 Kurdish militants in northern Syria in overnight attacks on militant targets, the Defence Ministry said on Saturday, as conflict in the region escalated nearly a week after a bomb attack in Ankara.
articles.title: Turkey says it 'neutralised' at least 14 Kurdish militants in Syria

articles.author: Henriette Chacar, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Palestinian gunmen infiltrated areas of southern Israel and rocket barrages were launched from the Gaza Strip on Saturday in a surprise attack claimed by the Islamist movement Hamas.
articles.title: Palestinian gunmen reported in Israel as barrages launched from Gaza

articles.author: Max Hunder
articles.description: In a burial plot next to a field outside the remote Ukrainian hamlet of Hroza, residents removed undergrowth and cleared away litter to make space for more graves.
articles.title: 'Half the village is gone': Ukraine hamlet reels after missile strike

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer arrived in China on Saturday leading a bipartisan congressional delegation and starting a series of meetings in the world's second-largest economy amid rising tension between Washington and Beijing.
articles.title: Schumer starts China trip amid tension with US, hopes to meet Xi
